reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me start by saying this really is a lovely hotel. It is very close to the train station and has a very nice interior. The rooms are among the nicest I've seen in my travels and very roomy by Italian hotel standards. It is well within walking distance of anything you want to see but is on the outer rim of historic florence. The thing that will keep me from returning is the service. I was spoiled in Rome by a hotel staffed with friendly people who greeted me in the morning, shook my hand, helped me arrange things as a matter of good service, and actually seemed happy to have me in their hotel. From the moment I entered the door, the staff at the Hotel Adler Cavalieri were cold to indifferent. They were professional but I can find professionalism in almost any hotel of that level. I was frankly disappointed in the service. As an example, I would expect for the price they charge per night that the desk personnel would be able to help me obtain a reservation at the Academia simply as a matter of good service. It was not until I actually reached the Academia that I learned they had charged me an additional 4 Euro per ticket simply for making a 30 second phone call to secure us a reservation. He did not even have the decency to inform us there would be an extra charge. It is the principle more than the extra 8 Euro that bothered me. If you're looking for service, look elsewhere because you won't find it at the Hotel Adler Cavalieri.
reviews.title: Will not return

Unfortunately did not find this hotel to be that good, more like an average three star than a four star. The staff were quite abrupt and bordering on rude when we arrived and the room was not as comfortable as other four star hotel rooms. There was a big breakfast selection, but none of it was tasty and the coffee was poor quality. Should be reclassified as a three star.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I got married in Florence on September 20, 2007. We stayed at the Hotel Adler Cavalieri from September 17th through September 21st and loved everything about the hotel. It was conveniently located within walking distance of all the famous shops and historical sites but yet far enough away from the crowds to where you can enjoy some peace and relaxation. The 5-star hotel that we had stayed at in Rome before arriving in Florence was nothing compared to Hotel Adler Cavalieri. Hotel Adler Cavalieri was a lot more spacious, beautifully decorated and very, very, very clean. The hotel staff (especially Franco) was excellent --- kind, courteous, helpful, accommodating and very professional.
reviews.title: A Memorable Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007
reviews.text: Things were very hectic on our wedding day (September 20th) but the staff at Hotel Adler Cavalieri helped us get through it successfully by coordinating the transportation for our families to the location of the wedding ceremony and the reception luncheon; and communicated to the respective parties to help us organize the day's activities. Everything turned out perfectly for our memorable day! And to top off the whole day, we had a bottle of champagne waiting for us in our hotel room compliments of Hotel Adler Cavalieri congratulating us on our lifelong union. We were so surprised and felt as if the staff at Hotel Adler Cavalieri were part of our family. It was a very kind gesture that we will never forget.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In addition to everything that Hotel Adler Cavalieri did for us before and during the wedding, they also took care of mailing our luggage with all the wedding outfits back to the United States after the wedding. We left Florence on September 21st to head to Paris for our honeymoon and did not want to carry around an extra piece of luggage (especially filled with wedding stuff) that we would not be using. Hotel Adler Cavalieri also took care of my wedding bouquet --- their florist is preserving the flowers and shipping it to me for my memoirs.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We made a trip to Italy in May of 2004 and the bulk of our time was spent in Florence. The Hotel Adler Cavalieri was our home base for 10 days, and it was a very comfortable hotel, within walking distance of the train station, bus depot, many great restaurants, beautiful churches, shopping, etc. Florence is a wonderful city and our hotel was clean, well-kept, comfortable and safe. While the rates may not be the most economical, our stay was memorable. The breakfast buffet was a great way to begin long days of sightseeing, and we enjoyed the gentlemen who staffed the breakfast room/bar ... very friendly and accomodating. Breakfast included many selections, hot and cold, and in the afternoons and evenings, the room became the pub with some nice offerings for snacks. Our room was comfortable and clean, with a sizeable bath (we did not have a tub, only a good-sized shower) and amenities were provided such as hand soap, shampoo, ear swabs, etc. We did not have much communication with the front desk, but the little contact we did have was fine. We were able to make ourselves understood with our limited Italian quite well. The Adler Cavalieri is located on a fairly busy street, but it was quiet at night in our room. We were able to walk everywhere we wished to go, and if we need to take a bus, the local lines were close by. I would recommend the Adler Cavalieri.
reviews.title: Comfortable Hotel in Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel in September 2007 and I forgot to write a review, but I think the hotel deserve to be recommended. There are countless hotels and accommodation in Florence and it is very difficult to pick up one. We selected this hotel on line, after having checked out many reviews and I was fearful of what we could have found. It was selected mainly because it is close to the station and we were travelling by train, but it is also within walking distance to the city, so the location is excellent. The building is old, (like most in the area) but the hotel is nicely refurbished and very clean. We had a room at the back of the building, near a courtyard, and it was very quiet. The bathroom was very nice and spacious, the bed comfortable and the wardrobe had a nice smell (either it is cleaned regularly with wood wax or it was new). We also had breakfast at the hotel, and I would also recommend it, also because there aren't any nice snack bar nearby so if you need a cup of coffee first thing in the morning the hotel offers the best option. On the whole, a great hotel for a reasonable price, very conveniently situated.
reviews.title: very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've never written an online review for a hotel -- I've just never had an experience bad enough or good enough to warrant the time and trouble. Until now. I was very pleased with my five-night stay at the Adler in Florence. I selected the hotel based on these reviews, with a little concern because of the negatives ones. But my visit was solid in all respects for a hotel of this caliber. The location was wonderful -- around the corner from the train station and the bus from the airport as well as on a bus line that took us from the hotel block to the Ponte Vecchio in under 10 minutes. We also enjoyed two meals at a restaurant 1 1/2 blocks away -- can't think of the name of the place the hotel recommended. Rooms were nice and clean (good cable TV with some channels in English), breakfast was fine, and the staff always helpful. When a strike in Paris forced us to stay a 6th night, the hotel took us back at the rate we'd been paying, which made life oh so much easier. Because of the overall value of the place and the good service we received, I decided to break down and write a review as a small way of saying thanks to the Adler.
reviews.title: Happy campers at the Adler Cavalieri

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights while on our honeymoon. The room we had was quaint, small, but nice. The bathroom was very nice and clean. The staff were somewhat helpful. The breakfast was decent. It had a good variety. The only issue I had with this place was the room we had... I believe it was #8. It was downstairs not far from the front desk. Our room had hardwood floors, as did the upstairs room. So we could hear the upstairs neighbors as they walked back and forth all night long. We could hear the all the flushing of toilets and shower of the neighbor next door. And being downstarirs, the maid starts cleaning there first, so we were not able to sleep in at all, because of the banging of the maid as she cleaned in the room next to us. If there are quieter rooms in this place, it would be a nice place to stay. Good location. But the room we had was not very private, nor romantic.
reviews.title: Decent hotel. But don't stay in a room downstairs.
